meanings.definition: Having more room than necessary in a piece of clothing.
meanings.sent1: Her pants were baggier than usual after she lost weight.
meanings.sent2: The sweatshirt felt baggier after it was washed and dried.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his shirt was baggier than a hot air balloon.
meanings.sent4: The dress hung on her like a baggier version of a curtain.
meanings.sent5: The jacket was so baggier that it looked like a tent on him.

meanings.definition: A bag or container that is loose or not tightly fitted.
meanings.sent1: She carried her books in a baggier to school.
meanings.sent2: The grocery store gave out reusable baggiers for shopping.
meanings.sent3: The baggier was so big, it could fit a whole picnic inside.
meanings.sent4: The traveler packed all their belongings in a baggier for the journey.
meanings.sent5: The baggier held more than just snacks; it was like a portable pantry.

meanings.definition: To become looser or less tight.
meanings.sent1: His shoelaces started to baggier as he walked.
meanings.sent2: The knot began to baggier as the rope was pulled.
meanings.sent3: The fabric seemed to baggier with each wash.
meanings.sent4: The grip on the handle started to baggier over time.
meanings.sent5: The elastic on the waistband would baggier after stretching it.
